ref: 2356 *urvara ʻ surplus, left over ʼ, urvarita -- ʻ left over ʼ BhP. [Poss. with EWA i 110 hyper -- sanskritism fr. Pk., but perh. conn. with ulvaṇá -- , ulba˚ ʻ excessive ʼ, Pk. ullaṇa -- , uvvaṇa -- ubba˚ and with urvárī -- f. ʻ wife presented with many others for choice ʼ AV., Pa. ubbarī -- f. ʻ concubine ʼ. S. with b and ḇ indicates early MIA. -- vv -- and -- bb -- ]
Pk. uvvaria -- ʻ left over ʼ, uvvaraṁta -- ʻ remaining over ʼ;
S. uḇiraṇu ʻ to be left over ʼ, uḇāraṇu ʻ to save ʼ, obari f. ʻ remnants ʼ, obāraṇu ʻ to leave food over (in eating) ʼ;
Ku. ubharṇo ʻ to be left over ʼ, tr. ubhārṇo;
N. ubro, ubāru ʻ surplus ʼ, ubranu ʻ to be left over ʼ, tr. ubārnu;
B. ubarā ʻ to be plentiful ʼ;
Or. ubaribā, ubur˚, ubor˚ ʻ to remain as surplus ʼ; O
Aw. ubaraï ʻ is saved ʼ, ubāraï ʻ saves ʼ;
H. ū˘barnā ʻ to be left over as surplus ʼ, tr. ubārnā, ubrā -- subrā ʻ surplus ʼ;
M. uver, ˚rī, ūr, urī f. ʻ remainder, surplus ʼ, urṇẽ ʻ to be left as a residue ʼ, uraviṇẽ ʻ to make to remain over ʼ, urakṇẽ ʻ to be over, be finished ʼ.
